meanings.definition: To move on hands and knees
meanings.sent1: The baby tried to becrawl towards the toy.
meanings.sent2: I had to becrawl under the low fence to retrieve the ball.
meanings.sent3: Watching the cat becrawl after a toy is always amusing.
meanings.sent4: The vines becrawled along the ground, reaching for sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The soldier had to becrawl through the mud during training.

meanings.definition: To cover or swarm over like crawling insects
meanings.sent1: The ants becrawl over the fallen fruit.
meanings.sent2: The spiders becrawl across the ceiling at night.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was ruined when ants decided to becrawl all over the food.
meanings.sent4: The darkness seemed to becrawl into every corner of the room.
meanings.sent5: The crowd began to becrawl towards the stage as the concert started.

meanings.sent1: The injured dog had to becrawl back to its owner.
meanings.sent2: The old car would becrawl up the steep hill.
meanings.sent3: The robot's attempt to becrawl across the room was comical.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to becrawl as we waited for the test results.
meanings.sent5: The snail would becrawl along the garden path, leaving a shiny trail behind.
